frameDefinitions: An Entity is rated as unexpected for its context in terms of its magnitude.
A Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical Opposing_force to a level specified by the target.

An Agent causes a Theme to move with respect to a certain Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape.
A Cognizer faces a choice on some Issue.
An Agent is described as pursuing an Activity, expending some effort.
A Protagonist is sensitive to a Trigger, which has the potential to cause some kind of reaction in the Protagonist.  '' 'Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are allergic to cats.'
frameExamples: The <t>entire</t> apple was riddled with worms .
The great and <t>impregnable</t> fortress still stands today.
Dave Hayes <t>wavered</t> about moving to California because so many of his friends are in Baltimore.
Sky, a Korean War veteran, was <t>active</t> in his opposition to Vietnam and continues to protest current combat in Iraq.
Mr. Clinton and his wife Hillary are <t>allergic</t> to cats.
listRoleDefinitions: The item which is described in terms of its expectedness in the context.
The <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> is the item that resists the <fen>Opposing_force</fen> to the level specified by the target.

The <fen>Opposing_force</fen> is the item placed in opposition to the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen>. <fen>Opposing_force</fen> hinders, blocks, helps, or allows (lets) the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> to resist at the level specified by the target. Sometimes this Core role is incorporated in the target; otherwise, it is often null instantiated in example sentences.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The location where the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
<fen>Theme</fen> identifies the object involved in motion.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the part of the Agent's body being used to manipulate the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the motion in place.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role  identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who repeatedly changes their mind about which of the <fen>Options</fen> to choose.
The <fen>Options</fen> are the alternative courses of action or the alternative physical or concrete entities that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> can choose from.
The <fen>Issue</fen> is a question about a course of action or a choice between items.

When there is an explicitly separate construal of the <fen>Options</fen>, <fen>Option_1</fen> is the first-mentioned alternative, typically in the form of a from-PP. When it is clear that  the <fen>Cognizer</fen> actually acted on their choice, <fen>Option_1</fen> is the alternative they embraced first before pursuing <fen>Option_2</fen>.

When there is an explicitly separate construal of the <fen>Options</fen>, <fen>Option_2</fen> is the second-mentioned alternative, typically in the form of a to-PP. When it is clear that  the <fen>Cognizer</fen> actually acted on their choice, <fen>Option_2</fen> is the alternative they embraced after abandoning <fen>Option_1</fen>.
This role denotes the <fen>Time</fen> interval during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> keeps changing their mind about which of the <fen>Options</fen> to select.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> keeps changing their mind between the <fen>Options</fen> that present themselves.
This role identifies the name of the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> engages.
The <fen>Agent</fen> engages in an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen>.
An entity acted upon by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
This role identifies the role filled by the <fen>Agent</fen> which is saliently associated with an <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> is pursued.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the  <fen>Activity</fen> is pursued.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen> occurs as the External Argument of the targets in this frame. The <fen>Protagonist</fen> represents the one exhibiting the response to the <fen>Trigger</fen>.

The <fen>Trigger</fen> most commonly occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>to</ment>. The <fen>Trigger</fen> is that substance or element which causes a health response in the <fen>Protagonist</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The entire <fex>day</fex> was spent on the project .
These are made from a tough <fex>plastic foam</fex> and are very light to wear.
The fortress was impregnable <fex>to attack by hostile invaders</fex>.
The retaining wall was even weaker <fex>yesterday</fex>, and had begun to crumble.
They decided the tree-house would be sturdiest <fex>in the big old backyard oak</fex>.
Kim twirled the glass <fex>in his fingers</fex>.
<fex>The wind</fex> vibrated the string.
<fex>I</fex> went back and forth over whether to post it or not, but the fact is that this blog is as much for you as it is for me.
In the late 1890s Carnegie vacillated <fex>between wanting to dominate the steel industry and wanting to sell out</fex>.
Editors go back and forth on a daily basis <fex>about what gets in the paper</fex>.
You've waffled <fex>from one explanation</fex> to another.
The heroine waffled from one plan <fex>to another</fex> and all of them were way out in 'left field'.

Here, however, the Romeros had provided some assurance to Ryan's mother of care,
although the court <fex>later</fex> waffled upon how much supervision was guaranteed
Do they know better than us that our dithering <fex>at the UN</fex> gave Saddam time to hide, destroy, and shuffle his weapons programs?
He is always active <fex>demolishing the painted figures of men's faith</fex> and then is astonished to find the faith still there clothed in new figure.
<fex>He</fex> was active for six decades as a painter, graphic designer and theorist of art and design.
<fex>As many as 324 companies' stocks</fex> were active across the board.
Jacques Fuller has been active <fex>as a sculptor</fex> in Bloemfontein for almost two decades.
Commercial selling was active <fex>yesterday</fex> but a lack of interest allowed the market to push sharply higher into the mid-session.
He is retired from Whirlpool Corp. in Clyde and is active <fex>at the YMCA</fex>.
<fex>Pat's</fex> allergy to dairy products is severe.
Some people are very sensitive <fex>to chemicals in the environment</fex>.
